title: Samajwadi Party leader dies after 1,000kg lighting pole crashes on his SUV in UP
content: A Samajwadi Party leader, Lal Bahadur Yadav, was killed when a 1,000-kg high mast lighting pole collapsed onto his moving car in Pratapgarh. The incident occurred during installation near Babuganj market, with eyewitnesses stating the pole lost balance suddenly. Police are investigating the alleged negligence and safety concerns.

title: 'Why is it not paying tax?': Priyank Kharge levels ‘money laundering racket’ charge against RSS
content: Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge has accused the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh of engaging in money laundering and questioned its sources of income. He demanded that the RSS, an unregistered organization, be held accountable and pay taxes like other citizens and entities under the law and Constitution.

title: How Pakistan can crash out of T20 World Cup after India defeat
content: Pakistan’s 61-run loss to India has put their T20 World Cup hopes at risk, with elimination possible depending on final Group A results. India have qualified for the Super Eights, while Pakistan sit third. Ishan Kishan’s 77 powered India to 175, before Pakistan collapsed for 114. Pakistan must beat Namibia and rely on other results to stay in contention.

title: AI Impact Summit to kick-off at 10am at Bharat Mandapam; PM Modi to inaugurate
content: India AI Impact Summit 2026 commences today in New Delhi, inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi. This landmark event, the first in the Global South, attracts global tech titans like Sundar Pichai and Sam Altman. Focused on people, planet, and progress, the five-day summit aims to foster equitable AI development and economic growth, with significant investment commitments expected.

title: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj–Tipu Sultan row: 8 injured in Pune clash; BJP seeks Sapkal’s resignation
content: A political storm erupted in Maharashtra over an alleged comparison between Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and Tipu Sultan. BJP leaders demanded the resignation of MPCC chief Harshwardhan Sapkal, calling the remarks an insult. AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi defended Tipu Sultan, sparking further debate and protests across the state.

title: India vs Pakistan: When hate didn't get a complimentary match pass
content: Despite a lack of handshakes between captains at the toss, a spirit of camaraderie was evident off the field in Colombo. Pakistani spinner Usman Tariq and Indian cricketer Harbhajan Singh shared a 'salaam', while actress Shabana Azmi emphasized sports and arts transcending borders. Fans from both nations also interacted cordially.

title: EC suspends 7 Bengal officials over ‘serious misconduct’ linked to SIR
content: The Election Commission of India has suspended seven officials in West Bengal for alleged serious misconduct and dereliction of duty. These Assistant Electoral Registration Officers, posted across Murshidabad, South 24 Parganas, West Medinipur, and Jalpaiguri districts, face immediate disciplinary proceedings. The Commission has directed the Chief Secretary to initiate action without delay and provide an update.

title: Cisco president Jeetu Patel reveals what developers company will never hire
content: Cisco's president Jeetu Patel mandates AI for all developers, aiming for half a dozen AI-coded products by 2026. This shift to spec-driven development sees human teams shrink, with AI agents tripling output. While embracing AI's potential, Cisco is investing heavily in security to prevent rogue agents, urging developers to master AI to stay relevant.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens below 25,450; BSE Sensex down over 100 points
content: Stock market today: After deep cuts towards the end of last week, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in red on Monday. While Nifty50 was below 25,450, BSE Sensex dropped over 100 points in opening trade.

title: Fearless without being reckless: Ishan Kishan's demolition job in Colombo
content: On a difficult Colombo surface that aided spin, Ishan Kishan’s fearless 77 off 40 balls powered India to 175 against Pakistan. While others struggled, Kishan stayed ahead of the conditions, dismantling the middle overs with innovation and intent, producing a defining T20 World Cup innings built on clarity, courage and control.

title: 'Don't lecture us, you can go...': Pentagon's warning to Anthropic
content: The Pentagon is reportedly considering ending its partnership with AI firm Anthropic over restrictions on military use of its technology. Anthropic refuses to allow its AI for mass surveillance of citizens or fully autonomous weapons, frustrating defense officials. While other companies are more accommodating, Anthropic's firm stance on ethical guardrails could lead to a complete termination of their collaboration.

title: US Presidents Day 2026: Are banks open in United States on February 16?
content: As the United States observes Presidents Day on Monday, February 16, federal holidays mean many services will be closed. Banks, government offices, and post offices will shut down, with no mail delivery. However, digital banking and ATMs remain accessible, and most retail stores and restaurants will operate normally.

title: ‘We can’t take chances’: Villages in Noida in grip of child-lifting rumours; parents quit jobs
content: Noida villages are in turmoil as unfounded rumors about child abductions circulate, causing a wave of panic. Families are withdrawing their children from school and many are leaving their jobs, overwhelmed by fear despite police stating there's no proof of such threats. This frenzy, intensified by viral social media posts, recalls troubling instances of mob violence sparked by false information.

title: 'Delhi declaration' may be adopted at AI summit in Delhi
content: India has launched its first comprehensive AI governance guidelines, opting for a flexible, principle-based approach to foster innovation while managing risks.  These seven 'sutras' emphasize trust, people-first development, fairness, and accountability.  The framework relies on existing laws and proposes new institutions to oversee AI, aiming to position India as a leader in responsible AI development.

title: UAE partners with Starlink to bring digital classrooms in 100 remote villages globally
content: The UAE has partnered with SpaceX's Starlink to bring digital education to remote students globally. This initiative, launched at the World Government Summit 2026, uses satellite internet to overcome infrastructure barriers, enabling access to online learning platforms and resources. The first phase targets 100 underserved locations, aiming to bridge the digital divide and empower learners worldwide.

title: ‘India rocked it’: Sachin hails win, Sehwag says ‘full kambal kuttai’ vs Pakistan
content: India secured a commanding victory against Pakistan in the ICC T20 World Cup. Ishan Kishan's powerful batting set the tone, followed by effective bowling from the Indian team. This win extended India's strong head-to-head record against Pakistan in tournaments. The team has now advanced to the Super 8 stage with an undefeated streak.

title: 'Every rule broken': US flags amateur plot failures in Indian national Nikhil Gupta case
content: US Department of Justice indictments against Nikhil Gupta reveal a crude, amateur plot lacking basic intelligence tradecraft.  Serving and retired officials highlight blatant violations of protocol, including direct communication with criminal middlemen and traceable electronics, suggesting a reckless haste that exposed the operation.

title: Shashi Tharoor calls Priyanka Chopra ‘remarkable’ after Harvard reunion
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor and Bollywood star Priyanka Chopra recently met at the Harvard India Conference. Tharoor shared his admiration for Chopra's success, noting her poise and wisdom. Chopra, a keynote speaker, spoke about her formative years in the US and her journey bridging Bollywood and Hollywood, inspiring students with her experiences.

title: ‘You don’t like Trump’: Hillary Clinton’s fiery exchange with Czech deputy PM — watch
content: Hillary Clinton and Czech Deputy Prime Minister Petr Macinka clashed at the Munich Security Conference over "woke" politics and gender identity. Macinka criticized gender and climate activism, while Clinton defended women's rights and questioned his stance. The exchange also touched on Donald Trump's impact on the US and the world.

title: Another World Cup match against Pakistan, another victory for India, Ishan se
content: India secured a Super-8 spot with a dominant 61-run victory over Pakistan, their fourth consecutive win. Ishan Kishan's explosive 77 off 40 balls powered India to 175, a total Pakistan couldn't chase. Jasprit Bumrah and Hardik Pandya's early wickets, followed by effective spin bowling, sealed the comprehensive win.

title: Team Canada rules out Brad Marchand, Josh Morrissey vs Switzerland
content: Team Canada faces Switzerland at the 2026 Winter Olympics without key players Josh Morrissey and Brad Marchand. Morrissey is sidelined with an undisclosed injury sustained against Czechia, while Marchand's absence remains unexplained. Seth Jarvis is set to make his Olympic debut, replacing Morrissey on the third line, with Travis Sanheim also stepping into the lineup.

title: Fact check: Viral crash video falsely linked to Jutta Leerdam wardrobe malfunction
content: The viral video claiming to show Jutta Leerdam crashing and tearing her suit at the Winter Olympics is false. The clip actually shows Suzanne Schulting at a December 2025 World Cup race in Norway, as reported by NU.nl. Meanwhile, Leerdam won gold at Milano Cortina 2026, with Jake Paul celebrating emotionally.

title: Charlie Kirk Honored by TPUSA Amid Backlash Over Bad Bunny Super Bowl Show
content: Super Bowl LX became a cultural flashpoint as Bad Bunny’s historic halftime show unfolded alongside a TPUSA alternative event honoring the late Charlie Kirk. Supporters paid tribute to Kirk with dedicated performances, while Bad Bunny delivered a cinematic, message driven production featuring over 300 dancers and a real wedding. Praise and criticism followed, including a sharp reaction from President Trump. The night highlighted a divided audience and two competing visions sharing the same stage.

title: What is Singapore-India-Gulf subsea cable system that UAE is investing in?
content: UAE telecom provider du has partnered to invest in the Singapore-India-Gulf (SING) submarine cable system, a new undersea fiber-optic network linking the Middle East with South and Southeast Asia. This strategic move reinforces the UAE's position as a regional data hub, enhancing connectivity for AI, cloud services, and global digital growth.

title: Vaibhav Suryavanshi Opts Out: Rising Bihar star skips CBSE exams; cites cricket, security concerns
content: Rising star Vaibhav Suryavanshi has made the tough decision to forgo his CBSE Class X exams as he dives headfirst into a demanding cricket schedule, heightened by security concerns. After leading his team to victory at the Under-19 World Cup, the talented batsman is placing his promising cricket career above academics.

title: US confirms death of Indian-origin student Saketh Sreenivasaiah; father says no official info yet
content: Tragedy has struck for a Karnataka family as the Consulate General of India in San Francisco confirmed the death of 22-year-old student Saketh Sreenivasaiah in Berkeley, California. His body was recovered, and the Consulate is offering full support for repatriation. Saketh's father, awaiting official word, expressed his distress.

title: T20 World Cup: How Pakistan created history despite losing match against India
content: Pakistan's reliance on spin against India in Colombo saw them bowl 18 overs of spin, equalling a T20 World Cup record. This spin-heavy approach, previously used against Australia in 2012, was part of a strategy that ultimately failed as India won by 61 runs.

title: 'O' Romeo' box office live: Shahid's film crosses Rs 30 cr over opening weekend
content: In a spectacular debut, Shahid Kapoor's 'O' Romeo' has shattered expectations at the Indian box office, amassing Rs 30.15 crore over its opening weekend. This romantic drama, though met with varied audience feedback on its narrative, has achieved a global total of Rs 40.6 crore. Read on to know more.

title: 'Yes, the pain is there': Kerala gives state farewell to baby who gave life to 4
content: Ten-month-old Aalin Sherin Abraham, the state's youngest organ donor, was laid to rest with full state honours. Declared brain-dead after a road accident, her organs gifted life to four children. Her family's extraordinary generosity brought solace amidst their immeasurable loss.

title: Feb 16–20: Traffic curbs in Delhi for AI Summit could slow your commute; TOI helps you plan
content: Delhi commuters face significant traffic disruptions from February 16-20 due to the AI Impact Summit at Pragati Maidan. Expect stricter rules, diversions, and potential road closures, especially during VVIP movements. Plan for extra travel time, utilize the main north-south Ring Road corridor, and consider the Metro for smoother journeys.

title: Is it really over between Cardi B and Stefon Diggs as there is no Valentine’s Day celebration?
content: Fans closely watched Valentine's Day for a public statement from Cardi B and Stefon Diggs following their post-Super Bowl Instagram unfollow. The absence of any tribute or mention from either celebrity has intensified speculation about their relationship status. While the silence fuels rumors, neither has officially confirmed a breakup but everything is pointing towards a seperation.

title: 'If the opposition doesn't allow the House to function, we will go for the guillotine': Rijiju
content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju announced that the no-confidence motion against Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla will be debated and voted on March 9. The second part of the Budget session, starting the same day, is expected to be "interesting" with crucial legislation. Rijiju warned that continued opposition protests could be detrimental to them and suggested potential cracks in opposition unity.

title: Islam Makhachev breaks silence on UFC White House fight talk
content: Islam Makhachev has revealed he wants to fight on the UFC White House card planned for June 14, calling it a possible historic moment. Speaking to Arena Fight TV, the welterweight champion said he feels better since moving up in weight and remains hungry for success. With names like Kamaru Usman and Ilia Topuria linked, his next opponent is still undecided.

title: Karnataka collects ₹11,112 crore through FASTag in three years
content: Union Minister for Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari said that Electronic Toll Collection (ETC) now accounts for more than 98% of user fee collection across the country, including Karnataka

title: Rupee slips 1 paisa to 90.67 against U.S. dollar in early session
content: A marginal rise in global crude oil prices and a sharp decline in the country's forex reserves also weighed on the local unit, according to forex traders

title: Residents flag health risks over Organic Waste Converter OWC construction at Godrej Eternity in Bengaluru
content: They claim that operating an Organic Waste Converter in close proximity to apartments will have an adverse impact on residents

title: India stands at forefront of AI transformation: PM Modi
content: PM Modi pointed out that AI today is transforming several sectors, including healthcare, education, agriculture, governance and enterprise

title: Karnataka’s Rohith Vemula Act stuck in red tape while proposed UGC regulations on caste discrimination on college campus stayed by Supreme Court
content: The debate on the proposed law has again come to the forefront after the Supreme Court of India stayed the UGC (Promotion of Equity in Higher Education Institutions) Regulations 2026, followed by agitations both for and against the regulations

title: India's first ‘cow culture’ museum to open in U.P.'s Mathura
content: The museum will convey the “religious, cultural, and spiritual significance of cattle, as well as the scientific utility of cows and their products”

title: E-application for Agniveer recruitment in Telangana opens
content: Applications are being invited from candidates domiciled in all 33 districts of Telangana that fall under the jurisdiction of the Army Recruiting Office, Secunderabad

title: AI Impact Summit: U.K. Deputy PM calls Delhi summit ‘important moment' to unlock full benefits of AI
content: During the AI Impact Summit this week, the U.K. is expected to announce new support for an African Language Hub, enabling AI to work in 40 African languages

title: Centre approves road projects worth over ₹11,000 crore in Maharashtra, Gujarat and Telangana
content: Approved by the Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs, these projects seek to improve freight movement, reduce travel time and enhance connectivity

title: Health department team deployed in Haryana village after 4 deaths due to hepatitis B
content: More than 400 people have been screened for symptoms in Chhainsa village in Hathin sub-division in Palwal district, officials said

title: An olive green recession
content: As fewer youths from Punjab join the armed forces, the residents of Nathowal, known locally as ‘faujian da pind’ (village of soldiers) in Ludhiana district, lay out the reasons. They tell Vikas Vasudeva that Agnipath’s uncertainty, drug fears, and the lure of foreign earnings, are pushing parents to send children away from home, creating a generation that’s dreaming beyond regimental traditions

title: Most professors of practice hired in Tamil Nadu followed by Maharashtra, Gujarat: UGC Data
content: According to the data, 1,841 PoPs have been hired by 349 HEIs so far, the maximum of them being in Tamil Nadu (395); while 193 PoPs have been hired in Maharashtra (193), Gujarat and Karnataka have appointed 179 and 170 professionals, respectively

title: Traffic woes to ease as at Madhya Kailash as Stalin opens flyover
content: The flyover will allow vehicles proceeding to Rajiv Gandhi Salai from Guindy to turn right, avoiding the traffic signal

title: NC, PDP slam BJP MP for spending 94% MPLAD funds in Uttar Pradesh
content: Leaders of National Conference and Peoples Democratic Party alleged that Jammu and Kashmir’s representation had been reduced to symbolism, with its people denied their rightful share of resources

title: Assault on workers while transporting cattle in Kasaragod: four held
content: They were taken into custody by Manjeswaram police inspector and his team following an intensive probe launched after the incident triggered controversy

title: Imbichi Bava hospital holds mini marathon
content: About 3,000 members of various organisations and clubs, along with students and trauma care teams, took part in the marathon, which concluded at Alathiyur

title: Cotton farmers oppose Goyal’s U.S. import remarks, warn of price crash
content: Farm bodies say zero-tariff raw cotton import from the U.S. will severely affect domestic price and devastate growers; several farmer bodies, particularly those working among cotton farmers, have decided to launch protests

title: 40 lakh devotees take holy dip in Ganga, Sangam on Magh Mela’s last day
content: The Magh Mela also remained in the news amid tensions between Swami Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati and the administration

title: Assam school students’ drive for urban bird nest conservation spreads wings
content: The Chorai Bandhob initiative of the children of Bongaon Chola High School expands to several institutions, promoting urban nesting spaces ahead of breeding season.

title: Debris of rockets with ISRO logo found near uninhabited island in Maldives
content: The debris of the Payload Fairing which are believed to be that of ISRO’s Launch Vehicle Mark-3 (LVM-3) washed up to an island near L. Kunahandhoo in Maldives

title: Watch: Mulund Metro accident: Five arrested, Rs 5 crore fine on contractor
content: Five people have been arrested following the fatal slab collapse at an under-construction metro site in Mumbai’s Mulund area on February 14, which killed one person and injured three.

title: Restricted access to AI summit on Day 1; expo to open for all from February 17
content: The expo will include pavilions from Australia, Japan, Russia, the United Kingdom, France, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Switzerland, Serbia, Estonia, Tajikistan, and Africa

title: Opposition slams PM Modi for ‘hollow words’ in ‘scripted’ interview
content: Opposition says Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s interview means “little in reality” and is an attempt to divert attention from a “damp squib” Budget and capitulation before the U.S.

title: We bore the blame for your mistakes, Congress MP Manickam Tagore tells DMK
content: In remarks made at a meeting of the District Congress Committee in Madurai, Mr. Tagore was indirectly referring to the corruption allegations against the DMK that resulted in the decimation of the United Progressive Alliance in the 2014 Lok Sabha election

title: Friend recalls his final conversation with Saketh; says he ate and engaged less over last two weeks
content: Sharing the news with grief, the friend, who requested privacy on LinkedIn in another post, says the revelation has shocked the entire community

title: Tipu Sultan row: FIR against Maharashtra Congress chief; stone throwing in Pune
content: The BJP protested in Pune as well as Mumbai by putting black ink on photographs of Congress leader Harshvardhan Sapkal and burning his effigies

title: Kerala can contribute to strengthening secularism: Amartya Sen
content: Joining Vision 2031 meet online, Prof. Sen draws attention to the State’s historical openness to the world at large. Historian Romila Thapar commends strides made by Kerala in literacy and education

title: India has entered recent trade agreements from a position of strength: PM Modi
content: Beyond tariffs, FTAs will reduce non-tariff barriers and expand global market access for Indian MSMEs, says PM; urges private sector to step up and take advantage of enabling policy framework

title: Vallalar’s birth anniversary will be celebrated for three days every year, says M.K. Stalin
content: The Chief Minister also announces the establishment of a research centre on the saint in Chennai. It will come up at the HR&CE Department headquarters in Nungambakkam

title: Maharashtra ATS conducts searches in two districts
content: Raids were conducted in Umarkhed and Pusad in Yavatmal over the suspicion that certain individuals were in contact with terrorist organisations, radicalising youths

title: Watch: MeitY: India hosts AI Impact Summit to democratise technology for Global South
content: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) said India’s AI Impact Summit will focus on democratising artificial intelligence for the Global South. The summit aims to ensure that AI development is inclusive and accessible, particularly for developing nations.

title: Across West Bengal, youth line up to apply for unemployment aid
content: Scheme offers monthly ₹1,500 to unemployed 21-to-40-year olds who are not prior beneficiaries of any government social welfare scheme; payouts likely before Assembly election, offering Trinamool a critical poll campaign plank

title: Hope for India-Bangladesh ties in Tarique Rahman’s development pitch: diplomatic sources
content: The Indian side keenly watched the campaign trail of Rahman and found that his 31-point agenda has several areas such as his plans in digital domain and infrastructure building that may help improvement in ties

title: Six from Haryana held for cheating in GATE
content: The police received information that certain individuals planned to cheat by providing unfair assistance to candidates through electronic devices

title: INDO-PACOM Chief praises Operation Sindoor, calls for vigilance, deeper India-U.S. defence cooperation
content: Remarks highlight Operation Sindoor, India-U.S. defence cooperation, vigilance, and Indo-Pacific security

title: Special pujas mark Mahashivaratri celebrations across NK region
content: Jatra draws huge crowds in Hubballi, while in Belagavi, long queues of devotees were found outside temples

title: Kerala setting newer models for the world, says Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Inaugurating the three-day international conference Vision 2031, CM says the coming five years offer the State an opportunity to bring together growth and justice, technology and humanity, modernisation and sustainability.

title: Mayoral poll: Battle for control of Karimnagar and Nizamabad municipal corporations poised for a nail-biting finish
content: With the main political parties lacking the requisite majority to clinch the mayoral posts, all eyes are now on the independent candidates whose support has become crucial in determining the mayoral election outcome

title: Concerns persist over SIR despite low number of omissions post hearing, say parties
content: Of the 4,06,366 voters subjected to verification, only 3,058 were found ineligible for inclusion in the final list. However, parties say clarity will emerge only after the final list is published on February 21

title: LDF, UDF poised to draw battle lines over Sabarimala women’s entry issue
content: Supreme Court decision to hear petitions challenging the 2018 judgment allowing women of all ages to enter the temple appears to give new political currency to the religiously emotive controversy

title: Watch: 10-month-old Alin Sherin, Kerala’s youngest organ donor, laid to rest with State honours
content: Ten-month-old Alin Sherin Abraham, Kerala’s youngest organ donor, was laid to rest with State and police honours on February 15 after an emotional funeral in Pathanamthitta. Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan, in a Facebook post, and Governor Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar hailed her parents’ decision as a noble act beyond words.

title: Study flags steady drop in Kerala’s southwest, northeast monsoon rainfall
content: ‘Kerala’s average rainfall during the southwest (June-September) and northeast (October-December) monsoons, the State’s primary sources of precipitation, decreased by 12.5% and 6.1% of the long-period average (LPA, 1971–2020) per 100 years, respectively, between 1901 and 2025’

title: Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge accuses RSS of money laundering
content: “They want us to be good citizens by paying income tax, but they want to remain free,” the Minister said at the release of a book recounting the horrors of communal riots in the coastal region

title: Upcoming election is a war between Delhi and Tamil Nadu, says Udhayanidhi
content: There is a group in our State that is roaming around — itonly makes noise, no ambition or ideology, nothing, says Deputy Chief Minister

title: BIAL to collaborate with government to promote Karnataka tourism
content: Karnataka is a strong destination, and the airport plays a very important role in promoting it, says Girish Nair, chief operating officer, BIAL

title: Pinarayi will be Kerala CM again, says Congress leader Mani Shankar Aiyar
content: He asks the LDF government to ‘pick up the baton that the Congress has dropped’ and shoulder the responsibility of taking Panchayati Raj forward in the country. While addressing an international conference organised by the State Planning Board, he criticised the absence of his party colleagues at the meet

title: Probe ordered into 1,499 abortions registered in Eluru district in 2025
content: Collector K. Vetri Selvi directs Police, Medical and Health departments to deploy decoy parties and register cases against scanning centres violating the PCPNDT Act

title: VACB records statements of sponsors, celebrities in Sabarimala flag mast gold misappropriation probe
content: The VACB team is collecting details regarding the quantity of gold donated by each sponsor for the flag mast project in 2017, officials said.

title: Kanthapuram calls for Samastha reunification, IUML backs move
content: He announces that the finale of the Samastha centenary celebrations will be held in Malappuram from January 28 to 31, 2027

title: Supreme Court asks FSSAI to consider warning labels for packaged foods high in sugar, salt and saturated fat
content: The top court ordered the food regulator to file its response within four weeks on introducing front-of-package warning labels on packaged foods high in sugar, salt and saturated fat

title: Tribal communities benefited more during YSRCP term, say leaders
content: At the 287th birth anniversary celebrations of Sevalal Maharaj organised at the YSRCP central office at Tadepalli, they hope more development will take pace if Jagan returns to power

title: Parents outraged after rats bite children at KGBV in NTR District
content: Food waste thrown in the open, overflowing septic tank and improper drains leave hostel premises squalid and turn it into a breeding ground for mosquitoes and rats

title: Got India’s commitment to stop buying Russian oil: U.S. Secretary of State Rubio in Munich
content: Earlier, India had said that it would maintain multiple sources for crude oil purchases and diversify them to ensure stability in the supply chain with national interests remaining the "guiding factor"

title: Stalin writes to Modi on registered Sri Lankan Tamils living in India
content: CM requests the Union government to rescind administrative instructions that barred the consideration of citizenship applications from Sri Lankan Tamils

title: Wild elephant damages car in Kerala’s Munnar, two escape unhurt
content: Two occupants of the car, both from Erattupetta in Kottayam, escaped unhurt as they remained inside the vehicle during the attack

title: MMK wants to contest in 5 Assembly seats: Jawahirullah
content: He also urges other alliance partners to give Muslims more representation while distributing tickets to candidates

title: West Bengal Chief Secretary given time till February 17 to fulfil ECI's pending directions
content: Another key issue is EC's directions to the State government to lodge FIRs against errant officials who "wilfully flouted" norms during the SIR process

title: HRD Minister Lokesh expresses solidarity with ‘kova bun’ vendor
content: Reacting to the viral video clip wherein the vendor from Kurnool district was allegedly forced by a group of YouTubers at Medaram Jatara to eat the delicacy he prepared to prove he was not resorting to ‘food jihad’, the HRD Minister, while expressing regret, says he looks forward to meeting Brother Vali and tasting the famous bun

title: Govt. medical college doctors to go on indefinite strike from Monday
content: The strike will include a long-term boycott of outpatient clinical services as well as all academic activities. From February 19, the doctors will boycott indefinitely non-emergency surgeries and other elective procedures also

title: Yadgir MLA writes to CM seeking funds for infrastructure development
content: Channareddy Patil Tunnur has submitted a requisition to the Chief Minister urging him to earmark ₹585.28 crore in the State Budget

title: Drug pushers’ attempt to lure children in juvenile homes in Kozhikode under scanner
content: The action follows the recent rescue of a missing 16-year-old boy from the company of a gang of suspected drug pushers in the city

title: Kim Jong Un's Nuclear Legacy Handed To 13-Year-Old, But Aunt Refuses To Bow
content: North Korea could be headed for a tense family showdown. South Korea's spy agency says Kim Jong Un's teenage daughter, Kim Ju Ae, is close to being named the country's next leader, a move that could set her against her powerful aunt, Kim Yo Jong

title: "I Don't Care": Indian Student's Chilling Words Days Before Death In US
content: Days before he went missing and was later found dead in California, Indian student Saketh Srinivasaiah ate and talked less and even went to classes in a bathrobe, showing clear signs of distress, his college roommate recalled.

title: AI Impact Summit 2026 Live Updates: From Job Disruption To Child Safety On Agenda
content: The global artificial intelligence summit kicks off in New Delhi today with big issues on the agenda, from job disruption to child safety, with world leaders in attendance.

title: Kerala Faces Dilemma As Supreme Court Reviews Sabarimala Women's Entry
content: The Supreme Court's consideration of review petitions on the Sabarimala women's entry verdict has once again placed the Pinarayi Vijayan-led Left government in a policy dilemma

title: Samajwadi Party Leader Dies In UP After Fuel Pump Pole Crushes Car
content: A 48-year-old Samajwadi Party leader has died after a high-mast light pole crushed his car in Uttar Pradesh's Pratapgarh district. Lal Bahadur Yadav was driving by a fuel pump when the high-mast pole was being erected

title: Gurugram Girl Dies By Suicide, Leaves Instructions On Where To Find Her Body
content: The body of a Class-11 student, who went missing from her house in Mokalwas village here three days ago, has been found from a pond near the village crematorium, police said.

title: India Eyes Big Role In Shaping AI Future With Mega Tech Chiefs Summit
content: India kicks off one of the world's largest artificial intelligence summits Monday, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi seeking to clear a path for India in a heated race to develop frontier models.

title: Bengaluru Bank Staff Uses Customer's Gold Worth 3.5 Crores To Fund Gambling
content: A deputy manager of a bank was arrested for allegedly misappropriating and unauthorisedly mortgaging 2,780 grams of customers' gold ornaments worth over Rs 3.5 crore, police said.

title: Hindus Among Four From Minority Communities Elected To Bangladesh Parliament
content: Four candidates from minority communities, including two Hindus, won in the recent general elections in Bangladesh, with all being nominees of the BNP, which is set to form the government.

title: Chicago Girl Fighting Father's Deportation Dies Of Rare Cancer At 16
content: A Chicago teen who spoke out for her father's release after he was detained last fall by immigration officials in a deportation case has died after battling a rare form of cancer.

title: MK Stalin Urges PM Modi To Solve Citizenship Issues Of 89,000 Lankan Tamils
content: With just two months to go for Tamil Nadu Assembly elections, Chief Minister MK Stalin has written to Prime Minister Narendra Modi seeking a "humane and pragmatic" resolution to the long-pending citizenship issue and legal status of Sri Lankan Tamils

title: India A Global Centre Of Goodwill, Social Harmony: RSS Chief
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday said India stands as a global centre of goodwill and social harmony, asserting that the country's civilisational ethos is rooted in a sense of oneness and mutual belonging rather than transactional relationships.

title: Man Dies 10 Days After SUV Driven By Minor Hit His Scooter In Mumbai: Cops
content: A 33-year-old man died due to his injuries on Sunday, ten days after a sport utility vehicle (SUV) allegedly driven by a minor hit his scooter in Mumbai, a police official said.

title: Mumbai Teen Hits Young Couple With SUV. He Used To Post Stunt Videos
content: Minors getting behind the wheel continue to pose a serious threat on Indian roads. The issue resurfaced yet again in Mumbai, where a late-night accident left a young couple fighting for their lives.

title: Reconciliation Or Retribution? Awami League Dilemma Before Tarique Rahman
content: A defining moment of Bangladesh's Prime Minister-elect, Tarique Rahman's press conference on Saturday was his response regarding the future of Awami League supporters.

title: Pick-Pocket Gang Posing As "Bohurupis" Arrested In Kolkata
content: At times they were the dusky Kali, at times the blue faced Shiva, or even Durga: They were the "Bohurupis" out on the streets of Kolkata. The Kolkata Police has now busted a gang pickpockets posing as Bohurupis.

title: Trump Says His Board Of Peace Members Pledged $5 Billion For Gaza
content: President Donald Trump said Sunday that members of his newly created Board of Peace have pledged $5 billion toward rebuilding war-ravaged Gaza.

title: Top Court Gives Monk 4 Years To Vacate Portion of Mumbai's Babulnath Temple
content: The Supreme Court has ordered a septuagenarian monk to evict an occupied portion in the iconic Babulanath Temple of Mumbai in four years and upheld the Bombay High Court's order directing his eviction.

title: Mani Shankar Aiyar's Prediction On Pinarayi Vijayan Return Sparks Row
content: Mani Shankar Aiyar's opinion that Pinarayi Vijayan will be back again as the Chief Minister of Kerala has sparked a furore in the Congress.

title: Key Hearing In Madhya Pradesh's Bhojshala Begins Monday
content: A hearing that could influence the future of the historic Bhojshala in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district will begin on Monday.

title: Lok Sabha may take up opposition's notice against Speaker Om Birla on March 9
content: the opposition's notice for a resolution for Om Birla's removal is likely to be taken up in Lok Sabha on the first day of the budget session’s second part on march 9 . the opposition’s bid for Birla’s ouster for his alleged partiality looks set to fall through .

title: AI models & campus labs: India's tech push at summit
content: Manash Pratim Gohain is a seasoned journalist with over two decades at The Times of India, where he has built a rich body of work spanning education policy, politics, and governance. Renowned for his incisive coverage of the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, accreditation reforms, and skilling initiatives, he has also reported on student politics, urban policy, and social movements. His political reportage—both reflective and news-driven—adds depth to his writing, bridging policy with public impact. Through his 2,500 articles and related outlets, he has emerged as a trusted voice in national discourse, particularly in linking education reform to broader societal change. Read More
